title: Brittany (administrative region)
summary: Brittany (Breton: Breizh [brɛjs]; French: Bretagne [bʁətaɲ] (listen)) is the farthest west of the regions of Metropolitan France. It is covers about four-fifths of the territory of the historic province of Brittany. Its capital is Rennes. It is the only one of two Regions in Metropolitan France that does not contains of any Landlocked Departments, the other being Corsica.
